amendment.description: Amendment sought to provide that each of the States of Alabama, Louisiana, and Mississippi has exclusive fishery management authority over all fish in the Gulf of Mexico within 3 leagues of the coast of that State, effective July 1, 1999.
amendment.purpose: An amendment printed in H. Rept. 105-641 to clarify that each of the States of Alabama, Louisiana, and Mississippi has exclusive fishery management authority over all fish in the Gulf of Mexico within 3 leagues of the coast of that State, effective July 1, 1999.

action.text: On agreeing to the Callahan amendment (A026) Failed by recorded vote: 141 - 283 (Roll No. 395).
